title: Chance The Rapper's wife Kirsten Bennett admits 'postpartum doesn't get any easier'
text:
They are settling into life as a family of four.

And to mark baby Marli Grace turning six weeks, both Chance The Rapper and his wife Kirsten Bennett shared a new picture of the adorable newborn.

'Dear Jesus, Thank you. She too fine,' wrote 26-year-old Chance, who took a break from touring to help his wife adjust to life as a mother-of-two.

Chance The Rapper's wife Kirsten admits 'postpartum doesn't get any easier'... as doting dad shares picture of new mom and baby Marli

Sharing the same image, which showed her wearing a blush gown and cradling her swaddled infant, Kirsten reflected on being a new mom, second time round.

'Mommy loves you my sweet Marli Grace,' wrote the 25-year-old.

'Postpartum does not get any easier- even with your second, but It will always be worth it for my babies. I can't wait to watch you grow up.'

The couple, childhood friends who married in March, welcomed Marli in August. She joins big sister Kensli, four.

After the birth Chance decided to take paternity leave, postponing his upcoming tour.

Doting father: After the birth Chance decided to take paternity leave, postponing his upcoming tour; he is seen here in a recent Instagram with his newborn

The 26-year-old rapper has said he had no idea how much more difficult it would be to have two children until their newborn arrived.

Chance explained: 'It's just way harder, honestly, having two kids than having one. Mathematically, it makes sense, but in my mind, it didn't register until I actually had two kids.'

The Cocoa Butter Kisses hitmaker said the tour decision was made as a 'group', because Chance didn't want to leave Kirsten at home with two young children by herself.

Family man: Chance, born Chancelor Johnathan Bennett, with wife Kirsten and their daughter Kensli in July; Chance met his wife with they were both young children

He added: 'I couldn't leave my wife at home with both of them, with the little one and the bigger one. It was a group decision.

'So yeah, [Kirsten] was thrilled when it went down that way.'

And Chance will be a big help at home, because he's already a pro at changing diapers, although he doesn't like getting up in the middle of the night.

Speaking on Jimmy Kimmel Live, he said: 'People make the diaper part seem so tough. I would much rather do diapers if I didn't have to wake up in the middle of the night, to be honest with you.'
description: To mark baby Marli Grace turning six weeks, both Chance The Rapper and his wife Kirsten Bennett shared a new picture of the adorable newborn.
